intro: Okay, fine. I know sc_2 won't tell you, but I know you really want to know. Just, don't tell anyone else, okay?
When you found me out in the territory... that hole in the ground that I wouldn't show you...
My friend was in there. Our friend. Me and sc_2's, I mean.
{PRONOUN/sc_3/subject/CAP} got infected really early on. {PRONOUN/sc_3/subject/CAP} {VERB/sc_3/were/was} already pretty sickly, so, it killed {PRONOUN/sc_3/object} pretty quickly.
I didn't want to leave {PRONOUN/sc_3/object}. I think sc_2 is still in denial about the whole thing, really.
name: [t_c chokes up for a moment. You feel a bit bad for asking.]
{PRONOUN/sc_3/poss/CAP} name was sc_3. {PRONOUN/sc_3/subject/CAP} {VERB/sc_3/were/was} wonderful.
{PRONOUN/sc_3/subject/CAP} really loved sunflowers. {PRONOUN/sc_3/subject/CAP} {VERB/sc_3/were/was} just like them, I think. Always looking up, never in the shade...
I guess that's why I never really buried {PRONOUN/sc_3/object}. I didn't want to hide {PRONOUN/sc_3/object} from the sun, you know?

Maybe it's good {PRONOUN/sc_3/subject} stepped out right as it all started.

I'll go find sc_2. Thank you.
sitwithyou: Thank you. I'm a bit tired of talking, too, actually...
[You crouch down next to t_c, and the emotionally exhausted cat begins snoring into your fur almost immediately.]

intro: That's fine. {PRONOUN/sc_1/subject/CAP} could never keep {PRONOUN/sc_1/poss} mouth shut.

[t_c skips away to go find {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} friend.]

I know you're going through a lot right now, y_c. But I'm convinced plove_inf_c will get better. r_m has been working hard for all of us, and {VERB/t_c/have/has} {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} ever let the Clan down?

But if somehow, something happens to plove_inf_c, I'll be here for you. Always.
[You purr in appreciation, letting a tiny smile appear on your face.]
[It's been a while since you've smiled.]
We'll get through this together, y_c. All of us.
infection_vicki_4: [Being infected sometimes has its advantages. Being able to talk to your mate, after you'd been separated for way too long, was one of them.]
[You know it's morbid, but it's the truth. You weren't sure if you could spend any more time away from t_c.]
[And you're perfectly aware they feel the same way, judging by the huge grin {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/greet/greets} you with when {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/see/sees} you approach.]
[{PRONOUN/t_c/subject}/CAP {VERB/t_c/press/presses} {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} head against your fur, and although it hurts, you allow it.]
[{PRONOUN/t_c/poss/CAP} purr is perhaps the loudest you've ever heard.]
Sweetheart! Oh, I've missed you so much!
[With a warped, raspy chuckle, you tell t_c that you haven't been gone for that long.]
Well, I feel as if it's been an eternity! I'm not sure if it's because of the whole 'being infected' thing, but...
Ah, nevermind that. Have you been holding up alright?
[You say that you've been as alright as you possibly can be. If you pay no mind to the constant pain and your decaying body...]
Oh, darling... I know. I know it's hard. But at least we can be rotting, crumbling messes together, don't you think?
[You can't help but agree with {PRONOUN/t_c/object}. Your body would've probably already given up by now if it weren't for t_c.]
[You have a glimmer of hope that this will all end soon. For now, the least you can do is keep fighting. For t_c.]

intro: y_c, do you need anything? Fresh-kill, water..?
[The young cat seems concerned, clearly stressed over this infection.]
